unittitle_ssm: Robert Gorham Davis Correspondence on the American Committee for Cultural Freedom
abstract_ssm: Robert Gorham Davis (1908-1998), was a literary critic and a professor of English at Columbia University. Davis served as chairman, and on the executive board of the American Committee for Cultural Freedom (ACCF) from 1953-1954, which was affiliated with the Congress for Cultural Freedom, an international organization. The collection contains correspondence of Davis, and third party correspondence for the year 1954, mostly incoming, and mostly concerned with the American Committee for Cultural Freedom, as well as some ACCF executive board minutes, memoranda and other internal documents.
corpname_ssm: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
persname_ssm: Schlesinger, Arthur M., Jr. (Arthur Meier), 1917-2007 -- Correspondence
